Reference.Description: Multiple XSS vulnerabilities in FortiManager GUI

Vulnerability.Title: Multiple XSS vulnerabilities in FortiManager GUI

cvrf:Acknowledgment.cvrf:Description: Fortinet PSIRT wishes to thank John Page for his commitment to Responsible Disclosure by responsibly disclosing these issues to Fortinet.

cvrf:Note.#text: The Graphical User Interface (GUI) of FortiManager v5.2.2 is vulnerable to two reflected Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities. 2 potential XSS vectors were identified: * XSS vulnerability in SOMVpnSSLPortalDialog. * XSS vulnerability in FGDMngUpdHistory. The Graphical User Interface (GUI) of FortiManager v5.2.3 is vulnerable to one reflected XSS vulnerability and one stored XSS vulnerability. 2 potential XSS vectors were identified: * XSS vulnerability in sharedjobmanager. * XSS vulnerability in SOMServiceObjDialog.
XSS items 1-2: FortiManager v5.2.2 or earlier. XSS items 3-4: FortiManager v5.2.3 or earlier.
Update to FortiManager v5.2.4. No workarounds are currently available.

cvrf:cvrfdoc.cvrf:DocumentTitle: Multiple XSS vulnerabilities in FortiManager GUI
